itinerary.mapNote: Farmland and Garadhban Forest. Easy opener. 60m.
Conic Hill view, then Loch Lomond east shore. 25m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Forest paths along the loch shore
itinerary.mapNote: Loch Lomond deepest point. Ben Lomond trailhead. 10m.
Green Welly Stop. Railway junction. Highland gateway. 240m.
Victorian hotel on Loch Tulla shore. Rannoch Moor ahead. 299m.
Crossing Rannoch Moor. Glen Coe mountains surround. 312m.
Devil's Staircase 548m. Dramatic descent to loch. 10m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Ben Nevis views & the "Old Man" statue
itinerary.mapNote: Glen Nevis finish. Ben Nevis towering above. 10m.

waypoints.name: Ben Lomond
waypoints.note: Scotland's most southerly Munro. Optional from Rowardennan.

waypoints.name: Rannoch Moor
waypoints.note: Vast bleak peatbog. One of Europe's last great wildernesses.

waypoints.name: Devil's Staircase
waypoints.note: Highest point on WHW. Military road zigzag. Glen Coe views.

waypoints.name: Glen Coe
waypoints.note: Scotland's most dramatic glen. Massacre site 1692. Unmissable.

waypoints.name: Ben Nevis
waypoints.note: Britain's highest peak. Optional 2-day extension from Fort William.

waypoints.name: Loch Lomond
waypoints.note: Britain's largest lake by surface area. UNESCO Biosphere. Days 2–4.
